title: What's with Rito pushing a roam meta?
body:
4 of the last 5 champ releases:

* Kindred: Has to roam to target jungle mobs
* Tahm Kench: Long distance teleport roam with ally teleport-roam assist
* Bard: Designated community-service trash-collector for the entire map
* Rek'Sai: global ult to tunnels, movespeed boosts, and easy wall jumping

And now the Quinn ult re-purpose for, guess what? Roaming.
I suppose it's more interesting than designated laning, but I do wonder what's with all the love for this one SPECIFIC gameplay facet over the past few months. No wonder OfA had the teleport meta (okay, I'll be honest, unless I'm in 3s, I use teleport. But still...)

replies.body: What is wrong with roaming? If the roam fails and they dont get anything or don't really help the lane they roamed for then it is worthless. No different if a jungler ganks and the enemy gets away with full HP instead of taking a jungle camp. There is always an outcome of the roam and maybe people should learn to ward better.

Not saying it's bad. Just feel like it's on Rito's mind a little more than it needs to be. There are other ways to improve this game too that are likely being ignored. And there are already existing highlights that are being dumped in favor of roaming. I mean, it's fine, but it shouldn't mean gutting one of the side roles of a well-loved champ.

RIP Assassin Bird
Roaming is just fun for some people. More champions to support that playstyle don't hurt.

The laning phase is just boring for competitive play. 
LC$BIGPLAY$
